prompt.content: What were the primary sources of synergies for Expand Energy Corp (NASDAQ: EXE)'s merger with Southwestern Energy, and how have the projected synergies changed over time since the announcement of the merger?

rubrics.name: Originally announced annual synergy target of approximately $400 M (run-rate)

messages.content: Originally announced annual synergy target of approximately $400 M (run-rate)

rubrics.name: Most recent October 2025 guidance update increased the annual synergy outlook to $600 M by the end of FY 2026

messages.content: Most recent October 2025 guidance update increased the annual synergy outlook to $600 M by the end of FY 2026

rubrics.name: Most recent October 2025 guidance indicated the deal was on track to hit $500 M in annual synergies by the end of FY 2025

messages.content: Most recent October 2025 guidance indicated the deal was on track to hit $500 M in annual synergies by the end of FY 2025

rubrics.name: Primary synergy sources includes: lower drilling and completion costs

messages.content: Primary synergy sources includes: lower drilling and completion costs

rubrics.name: Primary synergy sources includes: G&A reductions

messages.content: Primary synergy sources includes: G&A reductions

rubrics.name: Primary synergy sources includes: utilization of shared operational infrastructure

messages.content: Primary synergy sources includes: utilization of shared operational infrastructure

rubrics.name: Primary synergy sources includes: longer laterals

messages.content: Primary synergy sources includes: longer laterals
